arm_group.description: Repetitive pneumatic dilatation as the initial treatment followed by repetitive dilatation in case of dysphagia recurrence.
Laparoscopic myotomy and subsequent follow up.

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients with newly diagnosed achalasia have been submitted to either treatment with
      pneumatic dilatation or surgical myotomy. Minimal follow up five years.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pneumatic Dilatation or Surgical Myotomy for Achalasia

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients with newly diagnosed achalasia have been submitted to either treatment with
      pneumatic dilatation or surgical myotomy. Minimal follow up five years.

      During follow up patients have been interviewed with regular intervals, by use validated
      questionnaires. The level of symptom control has been assessed as well as the scoring
      cumulative incidence of treatment failures.

      Health Related Quality of Life (HRQL) has been regularly checked.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Newly diagnosed achalasia

          -  Age 18-80 years

          -  Informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous treatment for achalasia.

          -  Stage IV achalasia.

          -  Unwillingness to participate.

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Study to Compare Pneumatic Dilatation With Surgical Myotomy for Treatment of Achalasia - Long Term Follow up

primary_outcome.time_frame: At least five years after intervention

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
